result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard J Kauffman

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

8:40 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Richard J Kauffman in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Richard J Kauffman.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and outlines the offer as listed in the document.  State and Defense confirm the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 3 & 4, Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 3 & 4.  Court orders Counts 5 & 6 be dismissed and read in.  

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Herbers.
Defendant presents statements.
Court inquires if parties are ok with putting sentencing off to allow time for the defendant to be entered in the AODA program that was discussed.
State has no objection.
Defense has no objection.
Court will put off sentencing to allow time for the defendant to enroll and begin treatment; as long as the defendant is in treatment at the next court date the court will more than likley resolve by way of a fine only.
Atty. Herbers inquires if the defendant is in treatment at the time of the next court date he could appear by Zoom.
Court will allow zoom if the defendant is in treatment and cannot appear in person for the next court date.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:53 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court.   Defendant Richard J Kauffman did not appear.   Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Atty. Herbers provides an update, he is requesting a plea and sentencing date in about 60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

09:26 AM Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court.   Defendant Richard J Kauffman did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Attorney appears by authorization.
Attorney Herbers is requesting a new date to discuss this case with DA's office to determine is additional charges are going to be filed or not.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

08:46 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court.   Defendant Richard J Kauffman did not appear.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Atty. Herbers provides an update, his client wants some additional time to condider the offer.  Atty. Herbers is asking for a further proceedings date in about 30-45 days but may be converted to plea and sentencing.  Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Defendant to have no contact with Michelle G. listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:32 AM Defendant Richard J Kauffman in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
